intro: Podosemum lachnanthum, commonly known as the woolly podseed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink to white. Its fruit is a dry capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Podosemum lachnanthum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
